definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: The main sound box uses the edges and corners distinct rectangle design, the line succinct sprightly .
sentences.chinese: 主音箱采用棱角分明的长方形设计，线条简洁明快。

sentences.english: It's taking me a while to lock on to that tonic.
sentences.chinese: 锁定主音花了我一点时间。

sentences.english: So he went What would you guess those two chords are?
sentences.chinese: 于是他这样，你认为这两个主音是什么？

sentences.english: The dominant in a given key or tonality.
sentences.chinese: 所给调子或音调中的主音。

sentences.english: We almost fell asleep on that tonic chord.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在对主音和弦都有点审美疲劳了。

sentences.english: That held for about thirty seconds, that tonic chord.
sentences.chinese: 这样大概经过了30秒的样子，就是那个主音和弦。

sentences.english: So the first thing we got to do is sort of lock on to the tonic.
sentences.chinese: 我们来听一下，我们要做的第一件是是锁定主音。

sentences.english: So if you hear two chords rocking, it's probably tonic and dominant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你听到有两个和弦，这有可能是主音和属音。

sentences.english: You sing it for me.Here's the tonic.
sentences.chinese: 来唱给我听吧，现在是主音。

sentences.english: The end of that was all just the tonic.
So don't be--don't despair if you don't initially land on the tonic here.
sentences.chinese: 所以如果你不能一次找到主音也不要，，不必绝望。

sentences.english: He just sat there on the tonic forever.
sentences.chinese: 他不过是一直在主音上没动过。

definition: triad/musical chord of three notes, such as major triad do-mi-so
names of the notes of a musical scale (e.g. C, D, E or do, re, mi)
part (in multi-part instrumental or choral music), such as the soprano part or bass part
tonic triad/triad of the home key
